an10.171:4.1: “Mendicants, you should know bad principles with bad results.
an10.171:4.2: And you should know good principles with good results.
an10.171:4.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.
an10.171:5.1: And what are bad principles with bad results?
an10.171:5.2: Killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; speech that’s lying, divisive, harsh, or meaningless; covetousness, ill will, and wrong view.
an10.171:5.3: These are called bad principles with bad results.
an10.171:6.1: And what are good principles with good results?
an10.171:6.2: Avoiding killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; avoiding speech that’s lying, divisive, harsh, or meaningless; contentment, good will, and right view.
an10.171:6.3: These are called good principles with good results.
an10.171:7.1: ‘You should know bad principles with bad results.
an10.171:7.2: And you should know good principles with good results.
an10.171:7.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.’ That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.”
